title: Infinity Castle: Three Plucks
logline: With only three plucks before lock, an unmasked Intruder is blocked from early rooms and must coordinate through a resonance thread; at the final gate she enters Geisha Resource Dais, marks the Lure with contrast, and reveals hidden abnormal inflow early enough to change outcome.
theme: Time and access are part of diagnosis: predation hijacks attention through rhythm, while early MRI contrast and specialist coordination reveal hidden brain flow before collapse.

lines.text: In Infinity Castle Tatami Hall, one shamisen pluck triggers an alarm pulse and Castle String announces: three plucks until the channels lock.
A 16-year-old unmasked Intruder wakes disoriented and lost on tatami, facing endless sliding doors with no clear up or down.
Three plucks? Then I do not have time.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: Cut to Shifting Tatami Corridor: each pluck tilts the axis; threshold seals block entry, and she resists being thrown sideways.
Doors open to dense Hydrogen Crowd waves, but gate wards stop Intruder at each threshold and prevent direct contact.
I'm locked out. I need a channel to reach them now.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: Cut to Glass Water Chamber: she can only watch through lattice glass as divers recover slowly after each pluck, while barred rails block her path.
Cut to Sumo Tatami Ring: heavy bodies rebound first, but ward chains challenge every approach and force her back.
Cut to Bone Pillar Gallery: practitioners rotate around a fixed pillar while a tense guard ring refuses entry.
If I cannot enter, who can carry the signal inside?
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: Use the resonance thread. Speak once, they all hear.
lines.speaker: Castle String

lines.text: Intruder anchors a taut thread to the pillar and relays one instruction: resist the pull and hold footing on the next beat.
Crowd streams still merge toward Geisha Resource Dais; with each pluck, the final gate narrows toward lock.
Cut to Geisha Resource Dais: Geisha (Lure) lifts her fan; a hostile rhythm strips one obedient step of energy from each group.
T1 is recovery time after the pulse. Fat returns fast, water returns slow; these differences are read before collapse.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: Last pluck. The final gate opens for one source only, and Intruder chooses to enter the circle.
Come closer. Even your light belongs to me.
lines.speaker: Geisha (Lure)

lines.text: On the final beat she runs in, plants her feet, and the nearest hydrogen people stop collapsing and mirror her stance.
Contrast shortens local T1 where flow is abnormal. Early signal, clear target.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: She reaches Geisha (Lure) and stamps a gadolinium-contrast mark on Lure's wrist; cyan paths flare and expose hidden inflow.
Twist beat: Geisha (Lure) panics and freezes as the whole circle returns its gaze.
No... you were supposed to fall before the lock.
lines.speaker: Geisha (Lure)

lines.text: The full Hydrogen Crowd now stands steady and opposes the pull; the castle can no longer drag them forward.
Do not wait for collapse. If warning rhythm repeats, get brain MRI early and review it with a specialist.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: Extreme close-up: Geisha (Lure) locks eyes with Intruder; her pupils shake, fan hand trembles, and cyan reflection fractures across her gaze in pure shock.
Cut to pure black for a brief held breath.
A katana slash cuts across the black, severing the lure thread and collapsing the silhouette.
End card, large centered title text on black: "Early and timely brain MRI can reveal hidden changes in time. Talk to a specialist."
